title: Mark Levin Audio Rewind - 11/27/19
description:
On Wednesday's Mark Levin Show, KARN host Doc Washburn fills in for Mark. There is skepticism on whether the DOJ Inspector General's report on abuse of the FISA Court will result in people who broke laws being held accountable. Some conservative pundits say nothing will come of this, others disagree, including President Trump who's said this will be soon known as the biggest political scandal in America's history. Then, U.S Attorneys Durham and Huber have been investigating several tangents stemming from the genesis of the Russian collusion investigation. Former U.S Attorney Preet Bharara tells CNN that altering FBI information to sway the outcome of an investigation is a big deal. Afterward, are the Democrats losing steam on impeachment or are they gaining momentum from the recent remarks coming out of Congress?
